patient_info: Papilledema,Hepatic steatosis,Myocardial infarction,Coronary artery atherosclerosis,Splenomegaly,Thrombocytosis,Pulmonary arterial hypertension,Increased circulating IgA level,Difficulty climbing stairs,Osteoporosis of vertebrae,Dilatation of the ventricular cavity,Demyelinating motor neuropathy,Lower limb muscle weakness,Demyelinating sensory neuropathy,Left anterior fascicular block,Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology,Dysesthesia,Abasia,Left ventricular diastolic dysfunction,Left atrial enlargement,Abnormal peripheral nerve morphology by anatomical site,Abnormal thoracic spine morphology
golden_diagnosis: POEMS 综合征/POEMS syndrome/POEMS syndrome,POEMS 综合征/POEMS syndrome/POEMS syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
Step 1: The patient's symptoms of papilledema, hepatic steatosis, myocardial infarction, coronary artery atherosclerosis, splenomegaly, thrombocytosis, pulmonary arterial hypertension, increased circulating IgA level, difficulty climbing stairs, osteoporosis of vertebrae, dilatation of the ventricular cavity, demyelinating motor neuropathy, lower limb muscle weakness, demyelinating sensory neuropathy, left anterior fascicular block, abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology, dysesthesia, abasia, and left ventricular diastolic dysfunction suggest a range of rare diseases, including:
1. Neuromyelitis optica (NMO)
2. Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP)
3. Multiple sclerosis (MS)
4. Moyamoya disease
5. Autoimmune inner ear disease (AIE)
6. Hemifacial spasm (HFS)
7. Familial dysautonomia (FD)
8. Mitochondrial myopathy, encephalomyopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes (MELAS)
9. Progressive external ophthalmoplegia (PEO)
10. Fabry disease
